titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette to Thomas McKinster
CWG13846

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 3 ; 9 April - 25 May 1864

body.p:
421
May 4
Col. Tho. McKinster
Com'ding 68th Regt. E. M
Lawrence. County: Ky.
Colonel.

You are hereby ordered to call out your entire command to serve for the period of thirty days, and report with it for duty to the U S officer in command at Louisa Ky. A. state mustering officer will be there to muster in your companies and also to pay your gallant Regiment for services recently rendered under Col. Gallup.

If any of your command have enlisted for six months under the late call, you will not compel them to do service under this order, but require them to report at once to the state agent at the rendezvous mentioned in General Order No 3 from the Adjutant Generals Office.

As the emergency is equally as great it is hoped that your men and officers will be equally as prompt
over
422
meeting this call upon them as when their service were asked for by Col. Gallup
It being desired to present the claims growing out of this service, you to the U S for payment, you will not require the 3d Lieutenants of companies to respond to this call and be mustered in.
